summary:
**Lockheed F-104 Starfighter: Simple Summary**

The F-104 Starfighter was a fast, single-engine jet fighter made in the U.S. Designed to be light and simple, it could fly very high and fast. Though briefly used by the U.S. Air Force, it was mostly adopted by other countries like West Germany, Canada, and Italy. It was the first plane to reach Mach 2 and climb above 100,000 feet. However, it had a bad safety record, earning the nickname "Widowmaker." It was retired in 2004.
title: Lockheed F-104 Starfighter
